nodes.documentation:
@title The base contract that contains the base logic, structs and data that are needed
@author Andrew Ayson
nodes.name: TigerBase

nodes.documentation:
@dev The Birth event is fired every time a new Tiger is created.
This includes the creation through breeding and creation via gen0
nodes.name: Birth

nodes.documentation:
@dev [ERC721] This emits when ownership of a Tiger changes by any mechanism.
This event emits when Tigers are created (`from` == 0) and destroyed
(`to` == 0). Exception: during contract creation, any number of Tigers
may be created and assigned without emitting Transfer. At the time of
any transfer, the approved address for that Tiger (if any) is reset to none.
nodes.name: Transfer

nodes.documentation:
@dev [ERC721]  This emits when the approved address for an Tiger is changed or
reaffirmed. The zero address indicates there is no approved address.
When a Transfer event emits, this also indicates that the approved
address for that Tiger (if any) is reset to none.
nodes.name: Approval

nodes.documentation:
@dev This emits when an operator is enabled or disabled for an owner.
The operator can manage all Tigers of the owner.
nodes.name: ApprovalForAll
_transfer

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct TigerBase.Tiger storage ref[] storage ref

nodes.name: _createTiger

devdoc.author: Andrew Ayson

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: The base contract that contains the base logic, structs and data that are needed
